page.title: 03Education in Inverbervie
page.content: Due to so many new houses being built in Inverbervie in the last ten years, the school roll has increased considerably. During this time the school has become too small for all the children so an extension was added.After the work had started the school had to get three temporary portacabins for classes to work in. Now everthing is back to normal and we have a new office, library, special teaching areas, headmaster's office and an assistant head's office. Unfortunately these facilities are still too small for the 228 pupils of{ {Inverbervie School}and further extensions may be required. After seven years at Bervie Primary the children complete their schoolling at{Mackie Academy}in Stonehaven, travelling by bus leaving at 8.30am and returning at 4.30pm.
